intro: Cybianthus blanchetii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Cybianthus blanchetii is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in mountainous regions.
